prompt_to_run:
You will be given a task consisting of two parts:
1. A word-learning phase where you will be shown examples of a new word and give a similarity score of the word.
2. A similarity judgement phase where you will be asked to rate the similarity of pairs of objects for a total of 50 objects.


Mr. Frog speaks a different language, and you are helping him to pick out the object he wants. You'll be given a novel word and some examples of the word.

Here is a lig:
1. box truck

Now pick out the other ligs from the following list:
1. car
2. full-trailer truck
3. Labrador
4. box truck
5. carrot
6. bee
7. green bell pepper
8. bear
9. basset hound
10. red bell pepper
11. yellow bell pepper
12. cat
13. pumpkin
14. onion
15. loader
16. school bus
17. Dalmatian
18. eggplant
19. chiller truck
20. seal
21. crane


Next, for each pair of the objects below, rate the similarity of the two objects on a scale of 1 (not similar at all) to 9 (extremely similar). Try your best to base your ratings on the same aspects of the objects that were important to you in making your choices during the word-learning phase:

1. onion and cat
2. potato and yellow bell pepper
3. loader and Dalmatian
4. eggplant and garbage truck
5. onion and box truck
6. crane and tractor
7. car and red bell pepper
8. seal and red bell pepper
9. school bus and red bell pepper
10. bear and potato
11. green bell pepper and loader
12. school bus and garbage truck
13. onion and bee
14. car and full-trailer truck
15. Dalmatian and motorcycle
16. school bus and car
17. box truck and eggplant
18. school bus and full-trailer truck
19. pumpkin and box truck
20. seal and eggplant
21. crane and carrot
22. pumpkin and bear
23. basset hound and garbage truck
24. semi-trailer truck and Labrador
25. eggplant and mutt
26. semi-trailer truck and potato
27. chiller truck and Dalmatian
28. cat and Labrador
29. cat and toucan
30. green bell pepper and car
31. green bell pepper and motorcycle
32. motorcycle and mutt
33. car and box truck
34. car and Dalmatian
35. loader and box truck
36. cat and tractor
37. green bell pepper and potato
38. chiller truck and full-trailer truck
39. semi-trailer truck and red bell pepper
40. Dalmatian and mutt
41. green bell pepper and Dalmatian
42. school bus and terrier
43. car and loader
44. green bell pepper and crane
45. full-trailer truck and bee
46. terrier and Labrador
47. crane and toucan
48. basset hound and pig
49. cat and crane
50. car and motorcycle


The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"objects_chosen": {"description": "objects that the word applied to", "items": {"type": "string"}, "title": "Objects Chosen", "type": "array"}, "choice_explanation": {"description": "explanation of objects chosen", "title": "Choice Explanation", "type": "string"}, "similarity_score": {"additionalProperties": {"type": "integer"}, "description": "similarity score for each pair of objects", "title": "Similarity Score", "type": "object"}}, "required": ["objects_chosen", "choice_explanation", "similarity_score"]}
```

Please be sure to give similarity scores to ALL 50 pairs of objects listed above.

results.choice_explanation: Based on the example provided for the word 'lig', I've chosen objects that are closely related to vehicles, especially those resembling trucks or large vehicles.
